main event: A witness observed a bright object with the appearance of a star in Farmington, Michigan on January 23, 1958.
interesting points: The object was larger and brighter than the eastern star,It emitted a bright reddish glow as it passed over the horizon,The object was observed for 10 minutes while revolving with flashes,The sighting was concluded to be the planet Venus,There is a photograph included, though it is not very clear.
sighted object: one bright object resembling a star
witness description: The object was described as having a reddish glow and revolving with flashes.
